chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric M Garner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc.(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Correction Supervision Fees. DOC COLLECT
---------------------

Possess no weapons. No firearms. No ammunition.
---------------------

Obtain and maintain full-time employment, schooling, or combination of both. 
---------------------

Absolute sobriety. No alcohol use. No alcohol in the home. Not to enter any bar, tavern, liquor store, or establishment whose primary purpose is to sell alcohol. Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia. No association with any drug users or dealers. No prescription medication unless prescribed and then only in therapeutic amounts. No contact with co-actors, Rebecca Sobotka and Abbey Rockteacher.
---------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

BOND QUASHED

10:00am Court in session

Defendant Eric Garner present in court, in custody with attorney Jeramiah Maynard. ADA Andrew Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Matter before the Court is set for sentencing.
PSI Received & reviewed by the parties. 
No material corrections to be made. 

State has also reviewed Defense sentencing memorandum.

Deft's mother present in court & makes statement on Deft's behalf. 
John Dienberg, friend of Deft, present & makes statement on Deft's behalf. 

State's argument & sentencing recommendation. 
Defense argument & sentencing recommendation. 

Deft makes statement to the Court. 

Court makes record & sentences Deft: 

22CF51
Ct #1-
7 years WSP, bifurcated
3 years IC
4 years ES
Concurrent

22CF175
Ct #1-
2 years WSP, bifurcated
1 year IC
1 year ES
Concurrent

22CF207
Ct #1-
7 years WSP, bifurcated
3 years IC
4 years ES
Concurrent


Conditions of Extended Supervision to include:

Payment of all costs, fees & surcharges
DNA Sample & Surcharge
No weapons. No firearms. No ammunition.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment, schooling or combination of both
Absolute sobriety.No alcohol use; no alcohol in the home
Not to enter into any bar, tavern. liquor store or establishment whose primary purpose is to sell alcohol
Not to possessor use drugs or drug paraphernalia
No association with any drug users or dealers
No prescription medication unless prescribed to him & then only in therapeutic amounts. 
No contact with co-actors Rebecca Sobotka & Abbey Rockteacher

Deft has 175 days credit
Deft is eligible for programming

Defendants Memorandum in Support of Sentence Recommendation
Application for Jail Time Credit form
Petition for Waiver of Fees and Costs Affidavit of Indigency
Petition for Waiver of Fees and Costs Affidavit of Indigency
EFFECTIVE DATE OF ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

Defendant Eric M Garner in court, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by DDA James Sempf  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Eric M Garner. Called @ 3:00 p.m. Appearances made. Matter was before the Court for status on all files - 22CF207, 22CF175, 21CT486, and 22CF51. Record by Atty. Maynard as to agreement of the parties. Response by the State who confirms the agreement as stated. Court goes over the plea questionnaire with the defendant who responds to Court's questions. Court goes over maximum penalties, elements, firearm restriction, and voting rights with the defendant. Atty. Maynard responds to questions of the Court as to entry of pleas. 
Defendant pleads as follows:
22CF207 - GUILTY OF COUNT #1. COUNTS #2-#5 ARE DISMISSED AND READ-IN
22CF175 - GUILTY OF COUNT #1. COUNTS #2-#4 ARE DISMISSED AND READ-IN
22CF51 - GUILTY OF COUNT #1.  COUNTS #2-#7 ARE DISMISSED AND READ-IN
21CT486 IS DISMISSED AND READ IN.
ANY/ALL BAIL FORFEITURES ARE DISMISSED.
Court finds pleas to be knowing voluntary and intelligent, finds defendant guilty, orders PSI, and sets for sentencing. 
Parties have nothing further. Court in recess.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Eric M Garner appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA JJ Crawford.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Eric M Garner. Called @ 3:21 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 1st status on 22CF207, 2nd statuses on 22CF51 and 22CF175 with bail forfeiture tracking, and 4th status on 21CT486 with bail forfeiture tracking. Record by Atty. Maynard that he just received global offer, but defendant is asking for a couple of weeks to determine if he will accept the offer or ask for trial dates. Court sets all matters as requested. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eric M Garner in court, in custody by video.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Eric M Garner. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

BOND TO COVER 22CF207, 22CF51, 22CF175 & 21CT486

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH N.G. (dob 11/18/1992) OR A.R. (dob 4/30/1972). Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH CO-ACTOR REBECCA SOBOTKA. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eric M Garner in court, in custody by video.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Eric M Garner. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Maynard. Argument, granted. Reading of complaint waived Information filed. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

3:14 PM (64-06) Defendant Eric M Garner appeared in court, Attorney jeramiah maynard for Eric M Garner appeared in court, Attorney Andrew Herrmann for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.
Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
State is requesting 30 days for Arraignment Hearing.

Adj. 3:16 PM
Arraignment scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

2:32pm Court in session

Defendant Eric M Garner not in court, Attorney jeramiah maynard appeared in court. DDA Sempf appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Unknown why Deft does not appear. 
Deft bonded out of custody. 

State does have witness present. 
Atty Maynard asking that Court not issue a warrant & reset so that Atty Maynard can try & make contact with Deft. 
State makes record, Deft clearly had notice of today's hearing, State is asking for a warrant & bond forfeited. 

Court makes record. Court issues warrant, but stays warrant until 3pm on March 11, 2022 & will set a new preliminary hearing. 

If Deft does not appear at 3pm on March 11, warrant will issue. 

State makes record that Deputy is not available for the next 2 weeks due to training. 
State will supboena another Deputy for the 3/11 hearing. 

2:37pm Court in recess
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Original Bond filed with Court.  Defendant refused to sign bond.
